text:
Bundesliga
Borussia Dortmund: Achraf Hakimi evokes a return to Real Madrid
Sparkling with the BVB in the Champions League last night, the Moroccan international has raised the possibility of returning to Real Madrid.
06 Nov 2019, 13:21 by Thomas Rassouli



Mateu MoreyClub previous: FC Barcelona BIndemnity: noneIcon Sport



Julian BrandtClub previous: Bayer LeverkusenAdvance: 25 M ‚Ç¨ Icon Sport



Thorgan HazardClub previous: Borussia M√∂nchengladbachCompensation: ‚Ç¨ 25.5m Icon Sport



Nico SchulzClub previous: HoffenheimCompensation: ‚Ç¨ 25.5 million Icon Sport



Mats HummelsClub previous: Bayern MunichAdvance: ‚Ç¨ 30.5m Icon Sport

Borussia Dortmund: all the rookies of the transfer window 2019




Achraf Hakimi was in great shape last night. Holder with Borussia Dortmund on the right side of the defense, the one who has experienced several meetings as a winger has yesterday exceeded his function by going scored twice for the BVB. Two goals to give the victory to a Dortmund, however, badly embarked against Inter Milan, led from the first period.
The performance of the Moroccan international was therefore noticed, and has reinforced the Spanish press in the idea that he is the player that Zinedine Zidane needs at Real Madrid.




"It's my house"




Achraf Hakimi + 5 üì∑Credit Photo - Icon Sport

Good news since the side defender is currently on loan in Germany, but remains a player of Casa Blanca, where he is expected to return at the end of the season. A perspective that did not bother him at the beginning of the season, but which could seem to seduce him today. "Back to Real, why not, it's my home, where I grew up." he confided yesterday in the mixed zone.
